pr_title: support mysql insert select statement parse and add some test cases

timeline.message: support mysql insert select statement parse and add some test cases

timeline.bodyText:
Hi @strongduanmu
This PR looks clean and complete with many unit tests. Good job!
Besides, here are some of my questions, waiting for your feedback.

InsertSelectSegment and SelectSegment looks similar, do you think it is possible to remain either of them?
The existing class of SubquerySegment and new SelectSegment are alike somehow. Could you give them a look again?
Are there any consequent PRs needed to complete this feature later?
timeline.author: tristaZero
timeline.diffHunk:

+package org.apache.shardingsphere.sql.parser.sql.segment.dml.assignment;
+
+import lombok.Getter;
+import lombok.RequiredArgsConstructor;
+import org.apache.shardingsphere.sql.parser.sql.segment.SQLSegment;
+
+/**
+ * Insert select segment.
+ */
+@RequiredArgsConstructor
+@Getter
+public class InsertSelectSegment implements SQLSegment {

replies.bodyText:
@tristaZero Thank you for your suggestion:

InsertSelectSegment and SelectSegment should be able to be merged into one class. The two classes were originally designed to be consistent with the syntax rules in antlr.
SelectSegment is created with reference to SubquerySegment. Is it misleading to use SubquerySegment because Select is not a subquery in the Insert Select statement?
The pr related to route and rewrite will be submitted later. In addition, subsequent pr will also contain replace select statement.
replies.author: strongduanmu

timeline.message: replace InsertSelectSegment and SelectSegment with SubquerySegment
